properties.description: Community Support and Wellbeing from Bangor Parish Church. Everyone Welcome. Open Thursdays 2pm - 4pm and Saturday 10am - 12noon. Coffee drop in, clothing project, food support and friendly welcome. On Sunday's in the Church we have two worship services which all are welcome to attend.

properties.description: The Beacon is open to all to come and enjoy free refreshments and a warm environment on a Tuesday morning from 10 am to 12 noon. We have comfortable seating and toys for the children. On a Friday morning we open for men for the Men's cave from 10am to 12 noon.
properties.title: The Beacon

properties.description: A warm, welcoming, seated area with comfy seats and friendly volunteers who offer tea/coffee and snacks as well as conversation and support if desired. On Tuesdays there is homemade soup and rolls. On Wednesdays there are fresh scones.
properties.title: The Hub

properties.description: We provide a warm space for people to come together, with soup, toast and tea and coffee. Our community spaces are open Monday Wednesday and Friday to all. Our church hall 1 Brewery lane is also open Tuesdays for parents and toddlers, and on Sundays at 3pm for a community church service with tea and coffee after
properties.title: The Salvation Army

properties.description: A large welcome area with an entrance to the side of our main sanctuary. It offers community, company and coffee (or tea) and a light lunch on Tuesdays. Volunteers welcome you and help create a space where you can just be yourself. As a Christian church we offer practical love to everyone who comes.
properties.title: Welcome Centre - City Church Bangor

properties.description: 5 week warm space sessions open to support local parent carers who have a child under 5 and are parenting/caring for a child with a disability.

properties.description: Introducing a five-week series of warm space sessions tailored exclusively for local parents, carers, and the broader community. Sessions are specifically scheduled on weekends to accommodate those employed during weekdays.
